page.title: 09Lexham Vineyard
page.content: Lexham Vineyard is situated amongst the{landscape}of the northern slopes of the Nar Valley.It is an unusual example of local{industry}and was planted between 1975 and 1977.Today it covers an area of 8 acres.It is part of the Lexham Hall estate and continues a wine growing{custom}in the area that has been going on for 18 centuries. For efficient{farming}purposes the vines are supported by a 1 and a half metre trellis and 1 metre separates each vine with 2 metres between each row.Harvesting takes place in mid October and yields vary between 2 and 4 thousand bottles per acre.The wine is ready to drink by July the next year and is available from local shops.{
